page.title: 14 MERSEY FERRIES
page.content: The areas of{New Ferry}and{Rock Ferry are named after{Ferry routes}which used to cross the{Mersey. The New {Ferry Pier}used to be on a site on the river at the bottom of a road called{The Dell. }Our school is on that road. Sadly the ferries were taken over by the buses, trains and cars which use{tunnels}under the {Mersey.}This is much faster but {ferries}are cheaper and more enjoyable. Today only two of the many routes remain. {Liverpool to {Birkenhead}and{Liverpool to Wallasey. These have been threatened with closure. For centuries ferries were the only way to cross the Mersey. Fast flowing tides make it difficult for small craft. The ferries are still used to travel to and from work, but are mainly used for leisure now.
